security: Revealing CA's interest in anti-Castro groups and their operational activities could damage ongoing or future operations. Quoting directly: 'Subject Organization is of interest to CA/1...CA was going to permit (Kiraly) to meet with the representative of Subject Organization in order to determine whether (Kiraly) could be of help to Subject group.'
summary: A memo regarding the MOVIMIENTO DEMOCRATICA CRISTIANO, an anti-Castro group, and its potential interaction with Bela Kiraly of the Hungarian Freedom Fighters Inc., a CA-sponsored activity.
summary_one_paragraph: This memorandum, written by George Weademan, concerns the MOVIMIENTO DEMOCRATICA CRISTIANO, an anti-Castro organization that is of interest to CA/1 (presumably a CIA component). The memo indicates that the organization forwarded a letter to Bela Kiraly of the Hungarian Freedom Fighters Inc., a CA-sponsored entity. James Condon of CA/1 requested Office of Security data on the Subject Organization and the letter's author. The memo also notes that CA was considering allowing Kiraly to meet with a representative of the organization to assess whether Kiraly could assist the group, pending a review of security records which showed the letter writer was of previous Agency interest under an Operational Approval in 1960.
title: MOVIMIENTO DEMOCRATICA CRISTIANO
